summary:
"To Kill a Mockingbird" is a classic 1962 American movie based on Harper Lee's award-winning novel. It stars Gregory Peck as a lawyer in 1930s Alabama who defends a black man wrongly accused of rape. The film also features Mary Badham and Phillip Alford as his children, who learn about racism and injustice. 

The movie was a big success, winning three Academy Awards, and is now seen as one of the greatest films ever made, known for its powerful story and memorable characters. It's often recommended as essential viewing for young people.
title: To Kill a Mockingbird (film)
